hanzi-su-wiki:
発

Значения

Отправляться, отъезжать; начинаться; испускать, проявлять; печатать, выпускать в свет; развиваться

Мнемоника

  • Сокращение знака 發. Расставленные ноги стрелка 癶, ниже — лук 弓 и праща 殳. Начинать стрельбу, выпускать стрелу.

  • "Люди начали ходить на двух ногах."

Варианты

發, 发
purpleculture_pinyin:
fā
Japanese variant of 发
Японский вариант прически
rtega_mnemonic:
發發RS
发发		発issue, dispatch, send out, emit
  • RS. the action of 殳 on a bow 弓 to make the arrow go forward 癶: shoot
  • ⓢ hand 又 holding a crossbow ready to shoot: 发
  • two hands 开 issuing or sending out a message carried by legs 癶

発発RS
X		start from, depart, leave from/at, -x shots
  • 2 hands 廾 removing the gate bolt -; 閂 and leaving 癶; 開
 始; 去; 廃
heisig_constituent: discharge, teepee, wigwam, two, human legs
heisig_story: This key word refers to the discharging of guns, trains, people, and even words. The elements: teepee . . . two . . . human legs. Contrast the writing with frame 63.
Keyword_KANJIDIC: departure, discharge, publish, emit, start from, disclose, counter for gunshots
Keyword_KANJIDIC_ru: вылета, разряд, публикация, выделяющий, начиная с, раскрывает, счетчик для выстрелов
koohiiStory1: Two pairs of human legs poking out of a teepee: you know there´ll be a discharge soon, be it sexual, violent (husband returns home with a weapon), or dishonourable (soldier caught molesting a native), or perhaps all of the above.
koohiiStory2: I spent some time in her TEEPEE...just the TWO of us...but I looked between her HUMAN LEGS and I saw a nasty DISCHARGE...so I made my 出発　rather hastily.
kunYomi: た.つ、あば.く、おこ.る、つか.わす、はな.つ
jp_example_words:
開発(かいはつ): development, exploitation
活発(かっぱつ): vigor, active
再発(さいはつ): return, relapse, reoccurrence
始発(しはつ): first train
発(はつ): departure, beginning, counter for gunshots
発育(はついく): (physical) growth, development
発芽(はつが): burgeoning
発掘(はっくつ): excavation, exhumation
発言(はつげん): utterance, speech, proposal
発生(はっせい): outbreak, spring forth, occurrence, incidence, origin
発足(はっそく): starting, inauguration
発病(はつびょう): attack (disease)
発条(ばね): spring (e.g. coil leaf)
反発(はんぱつ): repelling, rebound, recover, oppose
発作(ほっさ): fit, spasm
蒸発(じょうはつ): evaporation, unexplained disappearance
発つ(たつ): depart (on a plane, train, etc.)
爆発(ばくはつ): explosion, detonation, eruption
発揮(はっき): exhibition, demonstration, utilization, display
発見(はっけん): discovery, detection, finding
発行(はっこう): issue (publications)
発車(はっしゃ): departure of a vehicle
発射(はっしゃ): firing, shooting, discharge, catapult
発想(はっそう): expression (music), conceptualization
発達(はったつ): development, growth
発展(はってん): development, growth
発電(はつでん): generation (e.g. power)
発売(はつばい): sale
発表(はっぴょう): announcement, publication
発明(はつめい): invention
出発(しゅっぱつ): depart
発音(はつおん): pronunciation
jp_readingExamples: 発明 (はつめい), 発射 (はっしゃ), 突発 (とっぱつ)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: Once you remove the lantern from the tent, we will be ready for departure. We can’t leave the lantern inside of the tent; that’s a fire hazard. We’d best take it with us before the departure. Don’t you agree?
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Feel the heat from the lantern. It’s not quite as comforting as being inside a tent, but it’s better than nothing. The lantern will light your way on your departure.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Oh! Don’t forget your hats (はつ) either. Wouldn’t want to start a departure without hats or a lantern. That’d be a short journey.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: How cold and unprotected would your head be without a hat? Very. Taking hats along with departures is integral to their success. Imagine how unsafe you would feel with no hats. That’s no departure I want to set out on.
Ru_Meaning: departure, discharge, publish, emit, start from, disclose, counter for gunshots
Ru_Radicals: 二 (два), 儿 (ножки), 癶 (крыша с точками)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the hairy legs (癶) come from the two (二) pairs of legs (儿) as an emission

яп. вм. 发

発

Значения

Отправляться, отъезжать; начинаться; испускать, проявлять; печатать, выпускать в свет; развиваться

Мнемоника

  • Сокращение знака 發. Расставленные ноги стрелка 癶, ниже — лук 弓 и праща 殳. Начинать стрельбу, выпускать стрелу.

  • "Люди начали ходить на двух ногах."

Варианты

發, 发

Radicals: 癶, 开  (tent, lantern)
Meaning Mnemonic
Once you remove the lantern from the tent, we will be ready for departure. We can’t leave the lantern inside of the tent; that’s a fire hazard. We’d best take it with us before the departure. Don’t you agree?
Feel the heat from the lantern. It’s not quite as comforting as being inside a tent, but it’s better than nothing. The lantern will light your way on your departure.
Reading Mnemonic
Oh! Don’t forget your hats (はつ) either. Wouldn’t want to start a departure without hats or a lantern. That’d be a short journey.
How cold and unprotected would your head be without a hat? Very. Taking hats along with departures is integral to their success. Imagine how unsafe you would feel with no hats. That’s no departure I want to set out on.
